faq.q: Do I need to be in game dev?
faq.a: No. The core is self-support, clarity, and shipping. Game dev is just one domain.
You feel quieter inside, you have a vision, you start a prototype, and you see the next steps clearly.
Yes — especially early teams: alignment, roles, decisions, and momentum.
Both. We can do one session, or a longer support track if it fits the case.

consulting.title: Consulting
consulting.lead: 1:1 sessions: see reality, regain your line, build a plan. $100–$150 per session, no hard time limit. For students/first-time teams — the first session is free.
consulting.whyLead: When it’s noisy inside, it’s easy to miss. We’ll make it quieter and sharper.
whyPoints: You step into the new and lose the spark.
You lead, but you carry everything and start falling apart.
A team got stuck and stopped moving.
consulting.howLead: A simple funnel: context → clarity → plan → motion.
topics: Production and moving to a goal in chaos
consulting.finalBody: Write 3 lines: 1) what you’re doing 2) where you’re stuck 3) what outcome you want.
